snippet: The Academy Awards’ lack of a core African-American presence is likely to be reflected in television ratings, Nielsen data shows.
abstract: The Oscar Hunt; Nielsen ratings data suggests that fact that no black actors are in running for Academy Awards, and that show's host will be white, is likely to affect number of African-American viewers who watch telecast; black television audience fluctuates far more than combined white and Hispanic audience, which has given demographic outsized role in determining Oscar ratings, despite its relatively small size.

byline.original: By MICHAEL CIEPLY and BROOKS BARNES

lead_paragraph: The Academy Awards’ lack of a core African-American presence is likely to be reflected in television ratings, Nielsen data shows.

headline.main: For Oscars Telecast, Few Black Nominees Mean Fewer Black Viewers
headline.print_headline: A Telecast in Search of Black Viewers
